metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5840 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The qtdemux_parse_samples function in gst/isomp4/qtdemux.c in gst-plugins-good in GStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap read) via vectors involving the current stts index.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-gconf - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3
gstreamer0.10-plugins-good - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3
gstreamer0.10-pulseaudio - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3').
gst-plugins-good1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4').
